speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: SCENE IV. A hall in Black-Friars.

speaker: Old Lady
text_entry: Trumpets, sennet, and cornets. Enter two Vergers,  with short silver wands; next them, two Scribes, in  the habit of doctors; after them, CANTERBURY alone;  after him, LINCOLN, Ely, Rochester, and Saint  Asaph; next them, with some small distance, follows  a Gentleman bearing the purse, with the great seal,  and a cardinal's hat; then two Priests, bearing  each a silver cross; then a Gentleman-usher  bare-headed, accompanied with a Sergeant-at-arms  bearing a silver mace; then two Gentlemen bearing  two great silver pillars; after them, side by side,  CARDINAL WOLSEY and CARDINAL CAMPEIUS; two Noblemen  with the sword and mace. KING HENRY VIII takes  place under the cloth of state; CARDINAL WOLSEY and  CARDINAL CAMPEIUS sit under him as judges. QUEEN  KATHARINE takes place some distance from KING  HENRY VIII. The Bishops place themselves on each  side the court, in manner of a consistory; below  them, the Scribes. The Lords sit next the Bishops.  The rest of the Attendants stand in convenient order about the stage

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Whilst our commission from Rome is read,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Let silence be commanded.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: What's the need?

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: It hath already publicly been read,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And on all sides the authority allow'd;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: You may, then, spare that time.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Be't so. Proceed.

speaker: Scribe
text_entry: Say, Henry King of England, come into the court.

speaker: Crier
text_entry: Henry King of England,  and c.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Here.

speaker: Scribe
text_entry: Say, Katharine Queen of England, come into the court.

speaker: Crier
text_entry: Katharine Queen of England,  and c.

speaker: Crier
text_entry: QUEEN KATHARINE makes no answer, rises out of her  chair, goes about the court, comes to KING HENRY VIII, and kneels at his feet; then speaks

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Sir, I desire you do me right and justice;

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: And to bestow your pity on me: for

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I am a most poor woman, and a stranger,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Born out of your dominions; having here

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: No judge indifferent, nor no more assurance

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Of equal friendship and proceeding. Alas, sir,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: In what have I offended you? what cause

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Hath my behavior given to your displeasure,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: That thus you should proceed to put me off,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: And take your good grace from me? Heaven witness,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I have been to you a true and humble wife,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: At all times to your will conformable;

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Ever in fear to kindle your dislike,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Yea, subject to your countenance, glad or sorry

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: As I saw it inclined: when was the hour

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I ever contradicted your desire,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Or made it not mine too? Or which of your friends

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Have I not strove to love, although I knew

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: He were mine enemy? what friend of mine

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: That had to him derived your anger, did I

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Continue in my liking? nay, gave notice

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: He was from thence discharged. Sir, call to mind

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: That I have been your wife, in this obedience,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Upward of twenty years, and have been blest

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: With many children by you: if, in the course

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: And process of this time, you can report,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: And prove it too, against mine honour aught,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: My bond to wedlock, or my love and duty,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Against your sacred person, in God's name,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Turn me away; and let the foul'st contempt

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Shut door upon me, and so give me up

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: To the sharp'st kind of justice. Please you sir,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: The king, your father, was reputed for

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: A prince most prudent, of an excellent

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: And unmatch'd wit and judgment: Ferdinand,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: My father, king of Spain, was reckon'd one

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: The wisest prince that there had reign'd by many

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: A year before: it is not to be question'd

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: That they had gather'd a wise council to them

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Of every realm, that did debate this business,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Who deem'd our marriage lawful: wherefore I humbly

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Beseech you, sir, to spare me, till I may

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Be by my friends in Spain advised; whose counsel

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I will implore: if not, i' the name of God,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Your pleasure be fulfill'd!

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: You have here, lady,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And of your choice, these reverend fathers; men

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Of singular integrity and learning,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Yea, the elect o' the land, who are assembled

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: To plead your cause: it shall be therefore bootless

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: That longer you desire the court; as well

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: For your own quiet, as to rectify

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: What is unsettled in the king.

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: His grace

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Hath spoken well and justly: therefore, madam,

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: It's fit this royal session do proceed;

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: And that, without delay, their arguments

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Be now produced and heard.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Lord cardinal,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: To you I speak.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Your pleasure, madam?

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Sir,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I am about to weep; but, thinking that

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: We are a queen, or long have dream'd so, certain

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: The daughter of a king, my drops of tears

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I'll turn to sparks of fire.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Be patient yet.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I will, when you are humble; nay, before,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Or God will punish me. I do believe,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Induced by potent circumstances, that

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: You are mine enemy, and make my challenge

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: You shall not be my judge: for it is you

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Have blown this coal betwixt my lord and me;

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Which God's dew quench! Therefore I say again,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I utterly abhor, yea, from my soul

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Refuse you for my judge; whom, yet once more,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I hold my most malicious foe, and think not

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: At all a friend to truth.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I do profess

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: You speak not like yourself; who ever yet

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Have stood to charity, and display'd the effects

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Of disposition gentle, and of wisdom

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: O'ertopping woman's power. Madam, you do me wrong:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I have no spleen against you; nor injustice

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: For you or any: how far I have proceeded,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Or how far further shall, is warranted

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: By a commission from the consistory,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Yea, the whole consistory of Rome. You charge me

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: That I have blown this coal: I do deny it:

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: The king is present: if it be known to him

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: That I gainsay my deed, how may he wound,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And worthily, my falsehood! yea, as much

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: As you have done my truth. If he know

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: That I am free of your report, he knows

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: I am not of your wrong. Therefore in him

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: It lies to cure me: and the cure is, to

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Remove these thoughts from you: the which before

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: His highness shall speak in, I do beseech

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: You, gracious madam, to unthink your speaking

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: And to say so no more.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: My lord, my lord,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I am a simple woman, much too weak

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: To oppose your cunning. You're meek and

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: humble-mouth'd;

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: You sign your place and calling, in full seeming,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: With meekness and humility; but your heart

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Is cramm'd with arrogancy, spleen, and pride.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: You have, by fortune and his highness' favours,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Gone slightly o'er low steps and now are mounted

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Where powers are your retainers, and your words,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Domestics to you, serve your will as't please

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Yourself pronounce their office. I must tell you,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: You tender more your person's honour than

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Your high profession spiritual: that again

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I do refuse you for my judge; and here,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Before you all, appeal unto the pope,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: To bring my whole cause 'fore his holiness,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: And to be judged by him.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: She curtsies to KING HENRY VIII, and offers to depart

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: The queen is obstinate,

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Stubborn to justice, apt to accuse it, and

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Disdainful to be tried by't: 'tis not well.

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: She's going away.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Call her again.

speaker: Crier
text_entry: Katharine Queen of England, come into the court.

speaker: GRIFFITH
text_entry: Madam, you are call'd back.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: What need you note it? pray you, keep your way:

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: When you are call'd, return. Now, the Lord help,

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: They vex me past my patience! Pray you, pass on:

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: I will not tarry; no, nor ever more

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Upon this business my appearance make

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: In any of their courts.

speaker: QUEEN KATHARINE
text_entry: Exeunt QUEEN KATHARINE and her Attendants

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Go thy ways, Kate:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: That man i' the world who shall report he has

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: A better wife, let him in nought be trusted,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: For speaking false in that: thou art, alone,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: If thy rare qualities, sweet gentleness,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Thy meekness saint-like, wife-like government,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Obeying in commanding, and thy parts

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Sovereign and pious else, could speak thee out,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The queen of earthly queens: she's noble born;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And, like her true nobility, she has

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Carried herself towards me.

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Most gracious sir,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: In humblest manner I require your highness,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: That it shall please you to declare, in hearing

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Of all these ears,--for where I am robb'd and bound,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: There must I be unloosed, although not there

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: At once and fully satisfied,--whether ever I

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Did broach this business to your highness; or

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Laid any scruple in your way, which might

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Induce you to the question on't? or ever

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Have to you, but with thanks to God for such

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: A royal lady, spake one the least word that might

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Be to the prejudice of her present state,

speaker: CARDINAL WOLSEY
text_entry: Or touch of her good person?

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: My lord cardinal,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I do excuse you; yea, upon mine honour,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I free you from't. You are not to be taught

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: That you have many enemies, that know not

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Why they are so, but, like to village-curs,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Bark when their fellows do: by some of these

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The queen is put in anger. You're excused:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: But will you be more justified? You ever

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Have wish'd the sleeping of this business; never desired

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: It to be stirr'd; but oft have hinder'd, oft,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The passages made toward it: on my honour,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I speak my good lord cardinal to this point,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And thus far clear him. Now, what moved me to't,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I will be bold with time and your attention:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Then mark the inducement. Thus it came; give heed to't:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: My conscience first received a tenderness,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Scruple, and prick, on certain speeches utter'd

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: By the Bishop of Bayonne, then French ambassador;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Who had been hither sent on the debating

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: A marriage 'twixt the Duke of Orleans and

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Our daughter Mary: i' the progress of this business,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Ere a determinate resolution, he,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I mean the bishop, did require a respite;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Wherein he might the king his lord advertise

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Whether our daughter were legitimate,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Respecting this our marriage with the dowager,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Sometimes our brother's wife. This respite shook

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The bosom of my conscience, enter'd me,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Yea, with a splitting power, and made to tremble

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The region of my breast; which forced such way,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: That many mazed considerings did throng

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And press'd in with this caution. First, methought

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I stood not in the smile of heaven; who had

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Commanded nature, that my lady's womb,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: If it conceived a male child by me, should

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Do no more offices of life to't than

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The grave does to the dead; for her male issue

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Or died where they were made, or shortly after

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: This world had air'd them: hence I took a thought,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: This was a judgment on me; that my kingdom,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Well worthy the best heir o' the world, should not

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Be gladded in't by me: then follows, that

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I weigh'd the danger which my realms stood in

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: By this my issue's fail; and that gave to me

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Many a groaning throe. Thus hulling in

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: The wild sea of my conscience, I did steer

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Toward this remedy, whereupon we are

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Now present here together: that's to say,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I meant to rectify my conscience,--which

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I then did feel full sick, and yet not well,--

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: By all the reverend fathers of the land

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And doctors learn'd: first I began in private

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: With you, my Lord of Lincoln; you remember

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: How under my oppression I did reek,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: When I first moved you.

speaker: LINCOLN
text_entry: Very well, my liege.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I have spoke long: be pleased yourself to say

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: How far you satisfied me.

speaker: LINCOLN
text_entry: So please your highness,

speaker: LINCOLN
text_entry: The question did at first so stagger me,

speaker: LINCOLN
text_entry: Bearing a state of mighty moment in't

speaker: LINCOLN
text_entry: And consequence of dread, that I committed

speaker: LINCOLN
text_entry: The daring'st counsel which I had to doubt;

speaker: LINCOLN
text_entry: And did entreat your highness to this course

speaker: LINCOLN
text_entry: Which you are running here.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I then moved you,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: My Lord of Canterbury; and got your leave

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To make this present summons: unsolicited

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I left no reverend person in this court;

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: But by particular consent proceeded

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Under your hands and seals: therefore, go on:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: For no dislike i' the world against the person

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Of the good queen, but the sharp thorny points

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Of my alleged reasons, drive this forward:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Prove but our marriage lawful, by my life

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: And kingly dignity, we are contented

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: To wear our mortal state to come with her,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Katharine our queen, before the primest creature

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: That's paragon'd o' the world.

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: So please your highness,

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: The queen being absent, 'tis a needful fitness

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: That we adjourn this court till further day:

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Meanwhile must be an earnest motion

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: Made to the queen, to call back her appeal

speaker: CARDINAL CAMPEIUS
text_entry: She intends unto his holiness.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: [Aside] I may perceive

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: These cardinals trifle with me: I abhor

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: This dilatory sloth and tricks of Rome.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: My learn'd and well-beloved servant, Cranmer,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Prithee, return: with thy approach, I know,

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: My comfort comes along. Break up the court:

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: I say, set on.

speaker: KING HENRY VIII
text_entry: Exeunt in manner as they entered
